refnamediv.refpurpose: Uppercase the first character of each word in a string

refentry.refsect1:
&reftitle.description;
stringucwords stringstr
stringdelimiters" \t\r\n\f\v"
Returns a string with the first character of each word in str capitalized, if that character is alphabetic.
The definition of a word is any string of characters that is immediately after any character listed in the delimiters parameter (By default these are: space, form-feed, newline, carriage return, horizontal tab, and vertical tab).

&reftitle.parameters;
str
The input string.
delimiters
The optional delimiters contains the word separator characters.

&reftitle.examples;
ucwords example
<?php $foo = 'hello world!'; $foo = ucwords($foo); // Hello World!
$bar = 'HELLO WORLD!'; $bar = ucwords($bar); // HELLO WORLD! $bar = ucwords(strtolower($bar)); // Hello World! ?>
ucwords example with custom delimiter
<?php $foo = 'hello|world!'; $bar = ucwords($foo); // Hello|world!
$baz = ucwords($foo, "|"); // Hello|World! ?>
ucwords example with additional delimiters
<?php $foo = "mike o'hara"; $bar = ucwords($foo); // Mike O'hara
$baz = ucwords($foo, " \t\r\n\f\v'"); // Mike O'Hara ?>
